definition: to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to penetrate/to pass through/thoroughly/completely/transparent/to appear/to show

sentences.english: Countless frustrations all his life made him see the ways of the world.
sentences.chinese: 命運多舛使他看透了人間百態。

sentences.english: "I can see right through you, " Bunny scolded.
sentences.chinese: “我已看透了你的壞心腸”邦尼訓斥着說。

sentences.english: Through the world, see light the world.
It can see through your clothing.
Clara has always been very perceptive about whether her employees are being honest.
sentences.chinese: 克拉羅總能看透他的員工是否誠實。

sentences.english: Who gave me love placid who accompany me to see through the fleeting landscape.
sentences.chinese: 㦨翩誰給我波瀾不驚的愛情，誰陪我看透流年的風景。

sentences.english: That is but a trifle, when a woman knows the world.
sentences.chinese: 只要一個女人看透了這個世界，這原本是小事一樁。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you will be able to see through one, it is also called the magic?
sentences.chinese: 否則，讓你一眼就能看透，那還叫魔術嗎？

sentences.english: She is better at observing externals than at reading hearts.
sentences.chinese: 她擅長觀察外表而不擅長看透內心。

sentences.english: It is not easy to see through a fair-weather friend.
sentences.chinese: 看透假朋友的本質是不容易的。

sentences.english: It'snot easyatall to see through a fair-weather friend.
sentences.chinese: 要看透一個人是酒肉朋友非常難。

sentences.english: Seen through the experience from the living world scenery.
sentences.chinese: 看透了世間風景，體會人間冷暖。

sentences.english: But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.
sentences.chinese: 屬靈的人能看透萬事，卻沒有一人能看透了他。

sentences.english: But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.
sentences.chinese: 屬靈的人能看透萬事，卻沒有一人能看透了他。

sentences.english: Ashenden wished he could have seen into his mind.
sentences.chinese: 艾舍登真希望自己能看透他的心。

sentences.english: Who among them can think he could outguess you?
sentences.chinese: 他們有誰自認可以看透你？

definition: see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to clearly understand
see 看破[kan4 po4]
to see everything clearly
to fully grasp/to penetrate
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
penetrating/thorough/incisive
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to see clearly
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to estimate/to surmise/to appraise
to see clearly
to read and understand
